property.name: text
property.value:
This model reads data from a Sensor Andrew node using the XMPP protocol
The XMPPSource actor will request a firing every time new data is published to the specified Sensor Andrew node, including one firing for the initial data
The SensorAndrewDataExtractor class extracts the data for the <transducerValue> node where the "name" attribute equals the value of the "name" parameter.
The model extracts the battery voltage, analog temperature, and y and z acceleration from the XML data from the Sensor Andrew node specified in actor XMPPSource.
The format of the output is completely flexible! This is defined in the XSL script. Currently, the ouput text is formatted like a Ptolemy record.
For another XSLT example, please see: $PTII/ptolemy/actor/lib/xslt/demo/MoMLFileTransformation/MOMLFileTransformation.xml

property.name: text
property.value:
DE director parameters are set as follows: stopWhenQueueIsEmpty: false, so the model will continue waiting for new events
stopTime: 10.0, ten seconds, so the model terminates for regression testing. Please change this value to have the model execute longer or indefinitely Note that if an event with a time later than ten seconds is enqueued, the director will continue execution until that later time, even though the event will not be fired.
synchronizeToRealTime: true, so that we can stop the model after stopTime real seconds

property.name: text
property.value: Since StringToXML outputs a whole chunk of XML, which may contain elements of various kinds, instruct the solver not to set up constraints between the input and output ports.

property.name: text
property.value:
Specify an ontology containing a concept for each type of unit to find in the data feed.
Here, name-matching is used for a first demo.
A better implementation would use the meta-data for the sensor feed and a standard ontology of units (starting with SI Base Dimensions and SI Derived Dimensions; can be extended to e.g. a community standard sensor ontology). The meta-data can be queried to ascertain which data feed elements supply data of a certain concept. For example, for the Sensor Andrew data feed, asking which elements supply voltage would return id="voltage", asking which supply acceleration would return id="acc_y", id="acc_z".
Please see $PTII/data/ontologies/test/DerivedUnitConceptTestCase.xml for an example of the SI units ontology.

property.name: text
property.value: SensorAndrewDataExtractor 1-4 Type in the element id you would like! (Double-click, enter the id, e.g. "Thermometer Analog")

property.name: text
property.value:
SensorAndrewDataExtractor 5-6 Let the ontology solver find the data for you based on the sink's type.
We added a manual constraint for each Display to indicate the type of data desired.
Then, we use the inferred concept on SensorAndrewDataExtractor's output port as the element id to search for. (Double-click, see the expression for the id parameter) This expression could be made part of the class definition for easy cut and paste.

property.name: text
property.value: Subscribe to Scaife Hall Room 208 sensor
